content.question:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

The manager of a large company that sells pet supplies online wants to increase sales by encouraging repeat purchases. The manager believes that if past customers are offered <math alttext="$10 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> off their next purchase, more than <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of them will place an order. To investigate the belief, <math alttext="90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> customers who placed an order in the past year are selected at random. Each of the selected customers is sent an e-mail with a coupon for <math alttext="$10 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> off the next purchase if the order is placed within <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> days. Of those who receive the coupon, <math alttext="38" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> place an order.

(a) Is there convincing statistical evidence, at the significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, that the manager’s belief is correct? Complete the appropriate inference procedure to support your answer.

frqParts.text:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

The manager of a large company that sells pet supplies online wants to increase sales by encouraging repeat purchases. The manager believes that if past customers are offered <math alttext="$10 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> off their next purchase, more than <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of them will place an order. To investigate the belief, <math alttext="90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> customers who placed an order in the past year are selected at random. Each of the selected customers is sent an e-mail with a coupon for <math alttext="$10 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> off the next purchase if the order is placed within <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> days. Of those who receive the coupon, <math alttext="38" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> place an order.

(a) Is there convincing statistical evidence, at the significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, that the manager’s belief is correct? Complete the appropriate inference procedure to support your answer.

(b) Based on your conclusion from part (a), which of the two errors, Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, could have been made? Interpret the consequence of the error in context.

topic.text: 6.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify key and relevant information to answer a question or solve a problem.
